intro: Corydalis brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy in texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in the wild.
